parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The image and text strongly suggest a reference to a political candidate.  The text "DACĂ NU VA HOTĂRÂȚI EU POT SĂ MAI RĂMÂN" translates to "IF YOU DON'T DECIDE, I CAN STAY". This is clearly a plea for votes, implicitly referencing the candidate himself. While the candidate's name isn't explicitly mentioned, the image clearly shows a person, and the context of the paid Facebook post strongly implies it's intended to influence voters in favor of that person.  The advertiser's name, "David F Dragos", further strengthens this connection.  Therefore, Article 36 (7) - a likely applies.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>Yes. This is a paid Facebook post, targeting a wide audience based on the provided insights data. The post is not a private message but is intended for public consumption, fulfilling the requirement of "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support the candidate shown in the image. The phrase "IF YOU DON'T DECIDE, I CAN STAY" is a direct appeal for votes, clearly aiming to influence the electoral outcome. Therefore, "Article 36 (7) - c" applies.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>No. The post lacks the characteristics of journalistic reporting. It does not present objective information or analysis but rather makes a direct appeal for votes, lacking the neutrality expected from journalistic content.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>No. This is not a personal opinion; it's a clear campaign message aimed at swaying voters' decisions during the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1219440599140823</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, with its image of a candidate and the text "IF YOU DON'T DECIDE, I CAN STAY", constitutes electoral propaganda.  The post directly appeals for votes, targets a wide audience through paid advertising, and lacks the objectivity of journalistic reporting. The advertiser's name, "David F Dragos", further strengthens the connection to a political campaign.  The post's timing, after the official campaign period, is also a crucial factor.  While there's no explicit mention of a party, the context strongly suggests it's intended to influence the vote in favor of the individual depicted.  The provided insights data confirms the post's wide reach.  There are no counterarguments to suggest this is not electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>David F Dragos</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Dragos David, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul 1219440599140823, care conține o imagine a sa și textul "DACĂ NU VA HOTĂRÂȚI EU POT SĂ MAI RĂMÂN",  având ca efect electoral influențarea voturilor în favoarea sa, constituind astfel propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea campaniei.  Postarea, fiind plătită și având o vizibilitate extinsă, se adresează publicului larg și are ca obiectiv clar influențarea votului, îndeplinind toate criteriile articolului 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
